intro: Austrostipa nivicola, commonly known as the snow grass, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically pale green to brown in color. Austrostipa nivicola thrives in cold, alpine environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a pioneer species in disturbed or glacial retreat areas.
